title: [sms-be-vip.twitter.com] vulnerable to Jetleak

profile.name: Twitter
profile.about: Twitter helps you create and share ideas and information instantly, without barriers.

vulnerability_information:
Version of Jetty installed on sms-be-vip.twitter.com (9.2.6.v20141205) is vulnerable to Jetleak. Jetleak allows to read arbitrary data from previous requests submitted to the server by other users. More information about Jetleak here: https://blog.gdssecurity.com/labs/2015/2/25/jetleak-vulnerability-remote-leakage-of-shared-buffers-in-je.html Tool to check Jeleak: https://github.com/GDSSecurity/Jetleak-Testing-Script Below sample HTTP request and response: GET / HTTP/1.1 Host: sms-be-vip.twitter.com User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:46.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/46.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br DNT: 1 Connection: close HTTP/1.1 200 OK Date: Thu, 09 Jun 2016 18:31:04 GMT Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1 Connection: close Server: Jetty(9.2.6.v20141205) Stratus.025: Welcome

Stratus.025
vulnerability_information_html:
Version of Jetty installed on sms-be-vip.twitter.com (9.2.6.v20141205) is vulnerable to Jetleak.
Jetleak allows to read arbitrary data from previous requests submitted to the server by other users.

More information about Jetleak here:
https://blog.gdssecurity.com/labs/2015/2/25/jetleak-vulnerability-remote-leakage-of-shared-buffers-in-je.html

Tool to check Jeleak:
https://github.com/GDSSecurity/Jetleak-Testing-Script

Below sample HTTP request and response:
GET / HTTP/1.1
Host: sms-be-vip.twitter.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:46.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/46.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,/;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
DNT: 1
Connection: close

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Thu, 09 Jun 2016 18:31:04 GMT
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Connection: close
Server: Jetty(9.2.6.v20141205)

<html>
<head>
<title>Stratus.025: Welcome</title>
<style type="text/css">
h1, p, table, a, body { font-family: Helvetica,Verdana,Arial; font-size: 11px; }
h1 { font-size: 13px; font-weight: bold; }
table { border: solid 1px #999999; border-collapse:collapse; empty-cells: show; padding:2px; }
th { font-weight: bold; background-color:#666666; color:#FFFFFF; text-align: left; }
th, td { border-collapse:collapse; border: solid 1px #999999; }
tr.queue { background-color:#F5F5F5; }
tr.warn { background-color:#FF9090; }
</style>
</head>
<body>
<h1>Stratus.025</h1>
</body>
</html>

activities.message:
Hello, thanks for your report. 

We're able to reproduce your results using the Jetleak Test Script but are you able to demonstate this exploit? If so, please provide us with detailed instructions on how to reproduce the exploit. Any images, or a video, that demonstrates the issue would also help us to evaluate this report. 

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Hello, thanks for your report.

We're able to reproduce your results using the Jetleak Test Script but are you able to demonstate this exploit? If so, please provide us with detailed instructions on how to reproduce the exploit. Any images, or a video, that demonstrates the issue would also help us to evaluate this report.

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.

give me a few days to create PoC. 

M.

activities.message:

We'll leave this set to "Needs More Info" until you're ready with a proof of concept. 

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Hi,

I attach a python script - modification of GDS Jetleak test script. After several runs i was able to extract some strings from memory. It still needs some calibration lets say (i,j and b parameters), but i believe it shows the way to extract data.

Below some data i collected put into few categories.

HTTP headers possibly:

net/package/htt

/http_request2) PHP/5.3.8\r\n

-Agent: JAX-WSI 2.1.5-hudson-$BUILD

e-HttpClient/4.3.6 (java 1.6 (java 1.5)\r\n...\

(java 1.5)\r\nAcc

coding: gzip,de

gzip,deflate\r\n\r

Some SOAP related parts with some user data:

http://www.3gpp.org/ftp/Specs/archive/23_series/23.140/schema/REL-6-MM7-1-4" xmlns:ns4="http://vmp.vzw.com/schema">vmp1_1465860777572

ns3:Number>█████████</
ber>█████<
██████</ns3:

ShortCode>40404</ns3:ShortCode></ns4:

Source></ns4:OptoutReq></S:Bod

s4:Source>SMS</

ns4:DeliverSMReq xmlns

ntent>█████

<ns4:Content>e █████████ is on line 2.███

██████████

███████</ns4:Co

████

 █████</ns4:
 
 ██████</ns4:Con

Certificate stuff:

DigiCert Secure Server ████

DigiCert Global Root ██████

██████████

█████████

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

I wish to write short post about it, can we dislose this?

Cheers,
Mateusz

activities.message: @molejarka, I've redacted the report of some potentially sensitive data. Otherwise this is good to disclose. Thank you for your participation in our bug bounty program.
